nodes.speaker: shal_thyss
nodes.text: [crystalline harmonics translate] Human vessel. You approach the Threshold Archive. Your kind were warned. The void-touched one among you knows the danger. State your purpose.

choices.text: We are explorers, seeking knowledge. We mean no harm.
[Interrupt] Torres, power weapons. We're not asking for permission.
[Press Further] "Warned by whom? What is this place?"
[Void Touched] "Your Archive sings a song of sorrow. I have heard it before, in the echoes between worlds."
[Previous Loop] "Shal-Thyss. Your people are dying. The Prometheus crew brought the Song of Unmaking. I'm here to help you break the cycle."

nodes.speaker: first_officer_torres
nodes.text: Weapons hot, Captain. They're putting up some kind of interference screen, but we can punch through.

choices.text: Fire a warning shot across their bow.
[Second Thought] Belay that order. Stand down weapons. My apologies, Shal-Thyss. My first officer is... cautious.

nodes.speaker: shal_thyss
nodes.text: Your resonance suggests truth. But searching for the lost often leads to joining them. The Archive remembers all who pass. Your vessel carries the stain of many timelines.

nodes.speaker: shal_thyss
nodes.text: This is a library of echoes, human. A record of all that has passed through this sector. The Prometheus crew came seeking a weapon. They found only an ending. They heard the Song of Unmaking.

nodes.speaker: shal_thyss
nodes.text: [frequency shifts to sorrow] You perceive the great truth. We are fading. The gates we built to connect worlds now unmake us. Each cycle, the Song grows louder.

nodes.speaker: shal_thyss
nodes.text: [The crystalline entity remains silent for 11 seconds, its internal light pulsing rapidly.] How? How could you know our name? The cycle... you are like them. The first crew. The ones who fractured time. You must be contained.

nodes.speaker: ship_ai_maya
nodes.text: Captain, I was able to create a counter-resonance that disrupted their containment field. They are surprised. They are... listening.

nodes.speaker: shal_thyss
nodes.text: Will you still enter the Archive, knowing it may show you truths that cannot be unlearned? Truths that may erase you from existence?

choices.text: We must. Help us understand so we don't repeat the mistakes of the Prometheus.
[Bluff] "We are not here for truth. We are agents of the Crimson Covenant, here to harvest echo-data."
[Paradox] "We have to enter, because in a future I remember, you told me it was the only way to save you."

nodes.speaker: shal_thyss
nodes.text: The Crimson Covenant... we have heard whispers of them. Very well. The Archive is open to you. But your resonance is... strange. We will be watching.

nodes.speaker: shal_thyss
nodes.text: My... future self? The logic is recursive. The cycle... it bends around you. This is a new resonance. Perhaps... perhaps you are the key. Enter. Find what you need.

nodes.speaker: shal_thyss
nodes.text: Then we shall resonate together. But be warned. The Archive does not simply show you the past. It makes you live it. You will see what the Prometheus crew saw. Feel what they felt.

choices.text: [Crew: Navigator Chen] "My navigator is one of the best. Can he interface with your Archive to guide us through the memories safely?"

nodes.speaker: shal_thyss
nodes.text: A navigator touched by the void... an interesting combination. Yes. His mind can serve as an anchor. The risk will be lessened, but the truths will be no less potent.

nodes.speaker: SYSTEM
nodes.text: The crystalline entity emits a piercing shriek. The space around you distorts as multiple Keth-Mori vessels de-cloak, weapons glowing with terrifying energy.

nodes.speaker: SYSTEM
nodes.text: The great crystalline archive opens before you, a library of lost timelines.

nodes.speaker: SYSTEM
nodes.text: You have agreed to experience the memories within the Archive. What you see will change you forever.

nodes.speaker: SYSTEM
nodes.text: Diplomacy has failed. You are now engaged in combat with the guardians of the Threshold Archive.
